DOC.HEADLINE: BRIEFLY : SECURITIES
DOC.TEXT: Settlement Reached in Towers Fraud Case : Steven Hoffenberg , who headed Towers Financial Corp. , agreed to pay more_than $ 516.5 million to settle fraud charges brought by securities regulators and a bankruptcy trustee.The Securities and Exchange Commission alleged that Hoffenberg cheated thousands of people out of about $ 500 million between 1987 and 1993 by misrepresenting the financial_condition of the company . The SEC alleged the company sold bonds and notes based on receivables that had been greatly overvalued and , in some cases , were pure fiction . Hoffenberg is to pay the SEC about $ 60 million , half of it for the bankruptcy payout to investors . He has admitted no wrongdoing .
